newsitem.title: UK: UK agency to prosecute ICI over waste leak.
newsitem.headline: UK agency to prosecute ICI over waste leak.

text.p: Britain's Environment Agency said on Friday it is to prosecute ICI Chemicals & Polymers Ltd after effluent from the company's Runcorn plant flowed into the Weston canal, in north west England, in October.
The Agency, a government body which oversees water quality in the UK, claims the unit of Imperial Chemical Industries Plc failed to maintain equipment and breached discharge limits.
It also believes there was an operational procedure failure leading to the effluent leak, a spokesman for the Environment Agency said.
The agency added that it was setting up a team to review the environmental management systems at the ICI plant.
